info.title: Duke Data Service API.
info.description: REST API to the Duke Data Service. Some requests require Authentication.

get.summary: List authorization roles for a context
get.description: Lists authorization roles for a given context.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Role Context, must be one of system, project

get.description: View authorization role details.

post.description: Creates a project for the given payload.

get.description: Lists projects for which the current user has the "view_project" permission.
Returns the project details for a given project uuid.

put.description: Update the project details for a given project uuid.

delete.description: Marks a project as being deleted.

put.description: Deletes any existing project role for the user and assigns new role.

get.summary: View project level affiliation for a user
get.description: View project level affiliation for a user

delete.description: Remove project level affiliation for a user

get.description: List project affiliations
Lists project permissions.

put.summary: Grant project level permissions to a user
put.description: Revokes (deletes) any existing project level authorization roles for the user and grants new set.

404.description: Project, User, or AuthRole Does not Exist

get.summary: View project level permissions for a user
get.description: View project permissions.

404.description: Project or User Does not Exist

delete.summary: Revoke project level permissions for user

404.description: Project or User Does not Exist

post.summary: Initiate a chunked file upload for a project
post.description: This is the first step in uploading a large file. An upload objects is created along with a composite status object used to track the progress of the chunked upload.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the client file to upload.

404.description: Project Does not Exist, or is not yet consistent

get.summary: List file uploads for a project
get.description: List file uploads for a project
Returns the immediate children of the project.

parameters.name: name_contains
parameters.description: list children whose name contains this string

parameters.name: exclude_response_fields
parameters.description: Space delimited list of fields to exclude from the serialized response.

401.description: Missing, Expired, or Invalid API Token in 'Authorization' Header

post.description: Initiates a project transfer from the current owner to a new owner or list of owners.

parameters.name: to_users[id]
parameters.description: The unique id of a user

get.description: list project transfers
View upload details/status

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Globally unique id of the upload object.

put.summary: Get pre-signed URL to upload the next chunk
put.description: Get pre-signed URL to upload the next chunk. This will also ensure that the project container exists in the storage_provider.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the chunk in bytes that the client will upload using the pre-signed URL.

parameters.name: hash[value]
parameters.description: The chunk hash computed by the client.

parameters.name: hash[algorithm]
parameters.description: The hash algorithm used (i.e. md5, sha256, sha1, etc.) - this must be the default algorithm supported by storage provider.

put.description: Complete the chunked file upload

parameters.name: hash[value]
parameters.description: The entire file hash (computed by client).

parameters.name: hash[algorithm]
parameters.description: The algorithm used by client to compute entire file hash (i.e. md5, sha256, sha1, etc.).

put.description: Report hash (fingerprint) for the uploaded (or to be uploaded) file.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The entire file hash (computed by client).

parameters.name: algorithm
parameters.description: The algorithm used by client to compute entire file hash (i.e. md5, sha256, sha1, etc.).

get.description: Lists project roles.
View project role details.
This allows a client to present an access token from a registered authentication service and get an api token
This allows a client to get a list of users, with an optional filter

parameters.name: last_name_begins_with
parameters.description: list users whose last name begins with this string

parameters.name: first_name_begins_with
parameters.description: list users whose first name begins with this string

parameters.name: full_name_contains
parameters.description: list users whose full name contains this string

get.description: Lists all activities

post.description: Creates an activity for the given payload.

get.description: Returns the activity details for a given UUID.

put.description: Updates the activity details for a given UUID.

delete.description: Marks an activity as being deleted.

post.description: Creates a WasUsedBy relationship. Entity cannot be used by an Activity that generated the same Entity.

400.description: Activity and Entity are required, Activity generated Entity.

post.description: Creates a WasGeneratedBy relationship. Entity can only be generated by one Activity, and cannot be used by the same Activity.

400.description: Activity and Entity are required, Entity can only be generated by one Activity, cannot be used by the same Activity.

post.description: Creates a WasDerivedFrom relationship.
Creates a WasInvalidatedBy relationship.

get.description: List the relations for a provenance node; this only lists direct relations for the node that are a single hop away.

404.description: Object kind or id Does not Exist

get.description: Show information about a Relation. Requires ownership of the relation, or visibility to a single node for the specified relation

401.description: Missing, Expired, or Invalid API Token in 'Authorization' Header

delete.description: Marks a relation as being deleted.

post.description: Search Provenance related to a start_node by max_hops degrees of separation (default inifinite)

parameters.name: max_hops
parameters.description: Maximum number of degrees of seperation from start node (default infinite)

404.description: start_node or start_node kind does not exist

post.description: This is a targeted query that navigates "up" the provenance chain for a file version to see how it was generated (i.e. by what activity) and from what source file versions. Given a list of file versions, this action perform the following query for each file version: 1. Gets the generating activity. 2. For the generating activity, gets the list of wasGeneratedBy and used file versions. A graph structure of the unique nodes and relationships is returned.
Search for DDS objects using the elasticsearch query_dsl on supported kinds of objects

parameters.name: include_kinds
parameters.description: The kind of objects (i.e. Elasticsearch document types) to include in the search; can include folders and/or files (i.e. dds-folder, dds-file)

404.description: One or more included kinds is not supported, or not indexed

parameters.description: The datatype of the keys value; currenty only the Elasticsearch core datatypes are supported
